label: spring
definition: A point where groundwater or steam flows out of the ground, and is thus where the aquifer surface meets the ground surface or where there is a fissure.

label: hot spring
definition: A spring that is produced by the emergence of geothermally-heated groundwater from the Earth's crust.

label: obsolete aquatic habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on water.

label: hydrothermal vent
definition: A fissure in the Earths's surface from which geothermally heated water issues.

label: obsolete marine habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a sea or ocean containing high concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids (typically >35 grams dissolved salts per litre).

label: rock
definition: A rock is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids.

label: soil
definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

label: waste water
definition: Water that has been adversely affected in quality by anthropogenic influence.

label: air
definition: The mixture of gases (roughly (by molar content/volume: 78% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.038% carbon dioxide, trace amounts of other gases, and a variable amount (average around 1%) of water vapor) that surrounds the planet Earth.

label: liquid water
definition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

label: sediment
definition: Sediment is an environmental substance comprised of any particulate matter that can be transported by fluid flow and which eventually is deposited as a layer of solid particles on the bedor bottom of a body of water or other liquid.

label: obsolete terrestrial habitat
definition: A habitat that is on or at the boundary of the surface of the Earth.

label: obsolete extreme habitat
definition: A habitat having at least one environmental quality that tends towards either the largest or smallest element of the set. The physical or geochemical extreme conditions found in an extreme habitat are often detrimental to the majority of life on Earth.

label: obsolete organism-associated habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a living thing.

label: biofilm
definition: A complex aggregation of microorganisms marked by the excretion of a protective and adhesive matrix; usually adhering to a substratum.

label: obsolete freshwater habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a body of water containing low concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids (<0.5 grams dissolved salts per litre).

label: sludge
definition: The residual semi-solid material left from domestic or industrial processes, or wastewater treatment processes.

label: fossil material
definition: A solid environmental material which is formed by the replacement of organic substances (including those in soils and sediments) with mineral material.

label: clay
definition: A group of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate (phyllosilicates being a subgroup of silicate minerals) minerals (see clay minerals), that are typically less than 2 micrometres in diameter. Clay consists of a variety of phyllosilicate minerals rich in silicon and aluminium oxides and hydroxides which include variable amounts of structural water.

label: obsolete animal-associated habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a living animal. Here "animal" denotes an individual of a species that is a sub-taxon of NCBITaxon:33208.

label: obsolete plant-associated habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a living plant. Here "plant" denotes an individual of a species that is a sub-taxon of NCBITaxon:33090 (viridiplantae).

label: environmental material
definition: A portion of environmental material is a fiat object part which forms the medium or part of the medium of an environmental system.

label: surface layer
definition: A layer of some material entity which is adjacent to one or more of its external boundaries and directly interacts with its immediate surroundings.

label: anthropogenic environmental material
definition: Anthropogenic material in or on which organisms may live.

label: microbial mat
definition: A multi-layered sheet of micro-organisms, mainly bacteria and archaea. Microbial mats grow at interfaces between different types of material, mostly on submerged or moist surfaces but a few survive in deserts.

label: silt
definition: Silt is granular material of a size somewhere between sand and clay whose mineral origin is quartz and feldspar.

label: sand
definition: A naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles.

label: organic material
definition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: mineral material
definition: A mineral material is an environmental material which is primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure.

label: water vapour
definition: Water vapour is a vapour which is the gas phase of water.

label: atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

label: layer
definition: A layer is a quantity of some material which is spatially continuous, has comparable thickness, and usually covers some surface.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: lithosphere
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: waste role
definition: A role that is realized in some process wherein the bearer is discarded or not utilized further.

label: gaseous environmental material
definition: A material entity which is composed of one or more chemical entities and has neither independent shape nor volume but tends to expand indefinitely.

label: astronomical body
definition: An object which is naturally occuring, bound together by gravitational or electromagnetic forces, and surrounded by space.

label: planet
definition: A planet is an astronomical body orbiting a star or stellar remnant that is massive enough to be rounded by its own gravity, is not massive enough to cause thermonuclear fusion, and has cleared its neighbouring region of planetesimals.

label: astronomical object
definition: An object which is composed of one or more gravitationally bound structures that are associated with a position in space.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: solid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.

label: liquid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a liquid state.

label: biosphere
definition: A biosphere is a part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: hydrosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: fossilization of organic material
definition: A process during which organic substances are replaced with mineral substrances, maintaining part of their anatomical organisation.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: solid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of solid environmental material.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid or gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of compounded environmental materials
definition: An mass of environmental materials which has appreciable quantities of several individual materials, such that the removal of one would convert the mass into a different entity.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in varying quantities.

label: obsolete cultured habitat
definition: Cultured habitat is an controlled habitat created by humans through laboratory techniques usually for the purposes of preparing cell, organ, tissue and plant tissue cultures.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: A liquid or a gas.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.
